meanings.definition: To fail to give expression to (a thought or feeling)
meanings.sent1: She often unvoices her true emotions to avoid conflict.
meanings.sent2: He unvoices his concerns because he doesn't want to upset anyone.
meanings.sent3: The shy girl unvoices her excitement about the party.
meanings.sent4: In the library, silence unvoices the noisy students.
meanings.sent5: The closed curtains unvoices the brightness of the sun.

meanings.definition: To silence or suppress (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: The teacher unvoices the students when they get too loud.
meanings.sent2: The dictator unvoices any opposition to maintain control.
meanings.sent3: The remote control unvoices the annoying TV commercials.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain unvoices the chirping of the birds.
meanings.sent5: The referee unvoices the crowd with a loud whistle.

meanings.definition: To remove or eliminate the sound of (a voice or sound)
meanings.sent1: The sound engineer unvoices the background noise in the recording.
meanings.sent2: The noise-canceling headphones unvoices the airplane engine.
meanings.sent3: The mute button unvoices the annoying talk show host.
meanings.sent4: The snowfall unvoices the usual city sounds.
meanings.sent5: The thick walls unvoices the neighbor's loud music.
